messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 55 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: HeadsetOff: Enabling Photorealistic Video Conferencing on Economical VR Headsets

Paper Abstract: Abstract. Virtual Reality (VR) headsets have become increasingly popular for remote collaboration, but video conferencing poses challenges when the user’s face is covered by the headset. Existing solutions have limitations in terms of accessibility. In this paper, we propose HeadsetOff, a novel system that achieves photorealistic video conferencing on economical VR headsets by leveraging voice-driven face reconstruction. HeadsetOff consists of three main components: a multimodal attention-based predictor, a generator, and an adaptive controller. The predictor effectively predicts user future behavior based on different modalities. The generator employs voice input, head motion, and eye blink to animate the human face. The adaptive controller dynamically selects the appropriate generator model based on the trade-off between video quality and delay, aiming to maximize Quality of Experience while minimizing latency. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of HeadsetOff in achieving high-quality, low-latency video conferencing on economical VR headsets.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 55 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 55"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Raw Data Measuring Broadband America 2023",
        "FaceTalk: Audio-Driven Motion Diffusion for Neural Parametric Head Models",
        "Apple Vision Pro",
        "Use spatial Persona (beta) on Apple Vision Pro",
        "High-fidelity Facial Avatar Reconstruction from Monocular Video with Generative Priors",
        "A Morphable Model for the Synthesis of 3D Faces",
        "ArcFace: Additive Angular Margin Loss for Deep Face Recognition",
        "Accurate 3D Face Reconstruction With Weakly-Supervised Learning: From Single Image to Image Set",
        "Free-HeadGAN: Neural Talking Head Synthesis With Explicit Gaze Control",
        "Subband coding algorithms for video applications: videophone to HDTV-conferencing",
        "Generative adversarial networks",
        "A Keypoint Based Enhancement Method for Audio Driven Free View Talking Head Synthesis",
        "Synthetic Data in AI: Challenges, Applications, and Ethical Implications",
        "GANs Trained by a Two Time-Scale Update Rule Converge to a Local Nash Equilibrium",
        "Long Short-Term Memory",
        "HTC VIVE - VR, AR, and MR Headsets, Glasses, Experiences",
        "FSVVD: A Dataset of Full Scene Volumetric Video",
        "Understanding User Behavior in Volumetric Video Watching: Dataset, Analysis and Prediction",
        "A buffer-based approach to rate adaptation: evidence from a large video streaming service",
        "From Capture to Display: A Survey on Volumetric Video",
        "Where Are You Looking?: A Large-Scale Dataset of Head and Gaze Behavior for 360-Degree Videos and a Pilot Study",
        "Ebublio: Edge-Assisted Multiuser 360° Video Streaming",
        "ISDN concepts, facilities, and services",
        "One-Shot High-Fidelity Talking-Head Synthesis with Deformable Neural Radiance Field",
        "Dynamic region of interest transcoding for multipoint video conferencing",
        "CaV3: Cache-assisted Viewport Adaptive Volumetric Video Streaming",
        "Towards a Simultaneous and Granular Identity-Expression Control in Personalized Face Generation",
        "Meta Quest",
        "Welcome to Microsoft Mesh",
        "NeRF: representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis",
        "A No-Reference Image Blur Metric Based on the Cumulative Probability of Blur Detection (CPBD)",
        "Anatomy of a failure: picturephone revisited",
        "Comparing Face-Tracking Action Units with EMG During Speech",
        "High-fidelity facial and speech animation for VR HMDs",
        "A Lip Sync Expert Is All You Need for Speech to Lip Generation In the Wild",
        "U-Net: Convolutional Networks for Biomedical Image Segmentation",
        "SJA: Server-driven Joint Adaptation of Loss and Bitrate for Multi-Party Realtime Video Streaming",
        "First Order Motion Model for Image Animation",
        "3-D physical motion-based bandwidth prediction for video conferencing",
        "A coded-domain video combiner for multipoint continuous presence video conferencing",
        "Face2Face: Real-Time Face Capture and Reenactment of RGB Videos",
        "Demo of FaceVR: real-time facial reenactment and eye gaze control in virtual reality",
        "The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the global web and video conferencing SaaS market",
        "Attention is All you Need",
        "VRChat",
        "One-Shot Free-View Neural Talking-Head Synthesis for Video Conferencing",
        "An analytically tractable model for video conference traffic",
        "Few-Shot Adversarial Learning of Realistic Neural Talking Head Models",
        "Towards Joint Loss and Bitrate Adaptation in Realtime Video Streaming",
        "TrimStream: Adaptive Realtime Video Streaming through Intelligent Frame Retrospection in Adverse Network Conditions",
        "DSJA: Distributed Server-Driven Joint Route Scheduling and Streaming Adaptation for Multi-Party Realtime Video Streaming",
        "Multi-Level Personalized Federated Learning on Heterogeneous and Long-Tailed Data",
        "Optimizing Efficient Personalized Federated Learning with Hypernetworks at Edge",
        "RepCaM: Re-parameterization Content-aware Modulation for Neural Video Delivery",
        "SadTalker: Learning Realistic 3D Motion Coefficients for Stylized Audio-Driven Single Image Talking Face Animation"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 55 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in HeadsetOff: Enabling Photorealistic Video Conferencing on Economical VR Headsets, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
